bibl.title: Letter from Francisco Argilagos Artigas to George A. Kellogg, September 24, 1941

div1.p: Artigas praises the Cornwell painting for honoring the work of Finlay. He discusses Cuban publicity pieces for the painting and the planned public exhibition of a reproduction.

div1.head: Letter from Francisco Argilagos Artigas to George A. Kellogg, September 24, 1941
div1.opener:
TRANSLATION OF LETTER FROM ASOCIACION FARMACEUTICA NACIONAL
HAVANA, CUBA
Sept. 24, 1941
Mr. George A. Kellogg
Director of Advertising for John Wyeth & Brother Inc.
Jersey City
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
I have duly received your letter in which you enclose interesting information
published in a magazine of that country in reference to the magnificent painting
of Dean Cornwell of the Series “Pioneers of American Medicine” in honor of the
great discovery made by our countryman, Carlos J. Finlay on the transmission
of yellow fever germs.

I did not correspond before to your letter because it was my desire to cooperate
in the publicity of the meritorious work of John Wyeth & Brother Inc. and I am
pleased to inform you that through Armando Maribona, a great newspaperman and
Cuban critic, I have succeeded in publishing an article on this interesting
subject in the magazine “Orbe” a Sunday supplement of “Diario de la Marina”
which I have the pleasure of enclosing.

Besides I am preparing a work to be published in the official organ of our
association, “Revista Farmaceutica de Cuba” in which, without the restrictions
imposed by daily newspapers, I shall emphasize the activities of John Wyeth &
Brother Inc. in order to perpetuate the memory of our great Finlay.

I am very grateful for the offer of the copy of the magnificent mural of
Cornwell and with the permission of Dr. Arturo M. Castro Valera, President of
the Asociacion Farmaceutica Nacional we gladly offer you our social building
for the exhibition of the painting in this city if you think this convenient.
I thank you for your kindness and remain
div1.closer:
Yours very truly Dr. Francisco Argilagos Artigas RM:DR
October 6, 1941
